answers.text: the breakdown of large insoluble food molecules into small water-soluble food molecules so that they can be absorbed into the watery blood plasma

qas.question: In some organisms, how are these molecules absorbed?

answers.text: these smaller substances are absorbed through the small intestine into the blood stream

qas.question: What are the two ways that food is broken down?

answers.text: the physical breakdown of large pieces of food into smaller pieces which can subsequently be accessed by digestive enzymes
enzymes break down food into the small molecules the body can use

context: Digestion is <a0_0>the breakdown of large insoluble food molecules into small water-soluble food molecules so that they can be absorbed into the watery blood plasma<a0_0/>. In certain organisms, <a1_0>these smaller substances are absorbed through the small intestine into the blood stream<a1_0/>. Digestion is a form of catabolism that is often divided into two processes based on how food is broken down: <a2_0>mechanical and chemical digestion<a2_0/>. The term mechanical digestion refers to <a3_0>the physical breakdown of large pieces of food into smaller pieces which can subsequently be accessed by digestive enzymes<a3_0/>. In chemical digestion, <a4_0>enzymes break down food into the small molecules the body can use<a4_0/>.
